exercises.name: 45" Incline Barbell Press
exercises.notes: 1 second pause at the bottom of each rep while maintaining tension on the pecs

exercises.name: Cable Crossover Ladder
exercises.notes: Do one set with low cable position, one set with medium-height cable position, and one height with a high cable position. If you only have one or two sets, choose the one or two cable positions you prefer

exercises.name: Wide-Grip Pull-Up
exercises.notes: 1.5x shoulder width overhand grip. Slow 2-3 second negative. Feel your lats pulling apart on the way down

exercises.name: High-Cable Lateral Raise
exercises.notes: Focus on squeezing your lateral delt to move the weight.

exercises.name: Pendlay Deficit Row
exercises.notes: Stand on a bumper plate. Focus on getting a big stretch and touch your stomach/chest on each rep

exercises.name: Overhead Cable Triceps Extension (Bar)
exercises.notes: Optionally pause for 0.5-1 second in the stretched aspect of each rep

exercises.name: Bayesian Cable Curl
exercises.notes: If you have a left-right bicep size imbalance, do these 1 arm at a time, starting with the weaker arm. Take the weaker arm to the listed RPE. Then match the reps with the other arm (stop once you've matched the reps, even if the RPE is lower). If you don't have a size imbalance, do these both arms at the same time.

exercises.name: Lying Leg Curl
exercises.notes: Set the machine so that you get the biggest stretch possible at the bottom. Prevent your butt from popping up as you curl.

exercises.name: Smith Machine Squat
exercises.notes: Once you are under the bar, set up your feet as you would a normal squat and then bring them forward ~3-6 inches. This will cause you to lean back into the bar slightly, allowing for a more upright squat, while also placing more tension on the quads. If your heels are raising at the bottom, you may need to bring your feet more forward. If your feet feel like they are slipping or your lower back is rounding at the bottom, try bringing your feet back a bit.

exercises.name: Barbell RDL
exercises.notes: To keep tension on the hamstrings, stop about 75% of the way to full lockout on each rep (ie, stay in the bottom 3/4 of the range of motion).

exercises.name: Leg Extension
exercises.notes: Set the seat back as far as it will go while still feeling comfortable. Grab the handles as hard as you can to pull your butt down into the seat. Use a 2-3 second negative. Feel your quads pulling apart on the negative.

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise
exercises.notes: 1-2 second pause at the bottom of each rep. Instead of just going up onto your toes, think about rolling your ankle back and forth on the balls of your feet.

exercises.name: Cable Crunch
exercises.notes: Round your lower back as you crunch. Maintain a mind-muscle connection with your 6-pack.

exercises.name: Neutral-Grip Lat Pulldown
exercises.notes: Do these pulldowns with the handle more out in front of you, more like a cross between pullover and a pulldown. Focus on feeling your lats working more than the weight you're using.

exercises.name: Chest-Supported Machine Row
exercises.notes: Flare elbows out at roughly 45° and squeeze your shoulder blades together hard at the top of each rep.

exercises.name: Neutral-Grip Seated Cable Row
exercises.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together, driving your elbows down and back.

exercises.name: 1-Arm 45 Cable Rear Delt Flye
exercises.notes: Pause for 1-2 seconds in the squeeze of each rep. Contract the rear delts hard!

exercises.name: Machine Shrug
exercises.notes: Brief pause at the top of the bottom of ROM. Think about pulling your shoulders up to your ears!

exercises.name: EZ-Bar Cable Curl
exercises.notes: Set up the cable at the lowest position. Maintain constant tension on the biceps. Slow, controlled reps.

exercises.name: Machine Preacher Curl
exercises.notes: Smooth, controlled reps. Mind-muscle connection with the biceps.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Set up a comfortable arch, quick pause on the chest and explode up on each rep.

exercises.name: Machine Shoulder Press
exercises.notes: Ensure that your elbows break at least 90°. Mind-muscle connection with your delts. Smooth, controlled reps.

exercises.name: Bottom-Half DB Flye
exercises.notes: All reps and sets are to be performed in the bottom half of the ROM. Focus on feeling a deep stretch in your pecs at the bottom of each rep.

exercises.name: High-Cable Lateral Raise
exercises.notes: Focus on squeezing your lateral delt to move the weight.

exercises.name: Overhead Cable Triceps Extension (Bar)
exercises.notes: Optionally pause for 0.5-1 second in the stretched aspect of each rep

exercises.name: Cable Triceps Kickback
exercises.notes: There are two ways you can do this: upright or bent over. Choose the one that feels more comfortable for you. The main thing is that when you're in the full squeeze, your shoulder should be positioned back behind your torso.

exercises.name: Roman Chair Leg Raise
exercises.notes: Allow your lower back to round as you curl your legs up. 10-20 reps is a broad range on purpose: just go until you hit the listed RPE with controlled form.

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.notes: Feet lower on the platform for more quad focus. Get as deep as you can without excessive back rounding. Control the negative and do a slight pause at the bottom of each rep.

exercises.name: Seated Leg Curl
exercises.notes: Lean forward over the machine to get a maximum stretch in your hamstrings.

exercises.name: DB Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.notes: Lower all the way down until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Drive through your front heel on the way up.

exercises.name: Leg Extension
exercises.notes: Set the seat back as far as it will go while still feeling comfortable. Grab the handles as hard as you can to pull your butt down into the seat. Use a 2-3 second negative. Feel your quads pulling apart on the negative.

exercises.name: Machine Hip Adduction
exercises.notes: Mind-muscle connection with your inner thighs. These are great for adding thigh mass from the front! Push them hard!

exercises.name: Machine Hip Abduction
exercises.notes: If possible, use pads to increase the range of motion on the machine: Lean forward and grab onto the machine rails to stretch the glutes further.

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise
exercises.notes: 1-2 second pause at the bottom of each rep. Instead of just going up onto your toes, think about rolling your ankle back and forth on the balls of your feet.
